dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 4183 IH: Stop Trafficking in Fentanyl Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rooney of Florida (for himself and Mr. Ryan of Ohio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To increase the penalties for fentanyl trafficking.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Trafficking in Fentanyl Act of 2015.
Section 401(b)(1) of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 841(b)(1)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 400 grams and inserting 20 grams; and
by striking 100 grams and inserting 5 grams; and
by striking 40 grams and inserting 2 grams; and
by striking 10 grams and inserting 0.5 grams.
